models module¶

class models.LSTM(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)¶

Bases: Module

A class used to represent a LSTM Model with flexible architectures.

Attributes:

num_epochs: The number of epoches runs for training. lstm_layers: List of LSTM layers. relu: Activation function. fc: Linear transformation to the output.

Methods:

forward(x): Build to process the input data throught layers and return the outputs.

forward(x)¶

Define the forward method to pass input.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – The input tensor.

Returns:

Output tensor.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

models.train(df=None, df_test=None, train_file=None, test_file=None, var=['HS'], hidden_dims=[60, 30], num_epochs=60, step_size=10, gamma=0.5, ts=30, lr=0.001, is_early_stop=True, threshold=20)¶

Trains an LSTM model using the training data and parameters, then plot the loss function, and evaluate it on the testing set.

Notes: This function performs the following steps: 1. Data pre-processing: Converts dataframes or files into sweData. 2. Model building: Initialises an LSTM model with the given parameters. 3. Training: Trains the model using the training data. 4. Loss plotting: Plots the training and validation losses over epochs. 5. Evaluation: Evaluates the model performance on the test data.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.Dataframe, optional) – The input data to train the model, default is None. (Either df or train_file must be provided, but not both.)

  • df_test (pandas.Dataframe, optional) – The input data to test the model, default is None. (Either df_test or test_file must be provided, but not both.)

  • train_file (str, optional) – The csv file path to load the data for training, default is None.

  • test_file (str, optional) – The csv file path to load the data for testing, default is None.

  • var (list, optional) – The features required for training, default is [‘HS’].

  • hidden_dims (list, optional) – The dimensionality of hidden layers, default is [60, 30].

  • num_epochs (int, optional) – The number of epoches runs for training, default is 60.

  • step_size (int, optional) – Step size for the learning rate scheduler. Default is 10.

  • gamma (float, optional) – Factor of learning rate decay. Default is 0.5.

  • ts (int, optional) – The time sequence length, the number of time steps to be considered in model, default is 30.

  • lr (float, optional) – The initial learning rate, default is 0.001.

  • is_early_stop (bool, optional) – Whether to use early stopping during training. Default is True.

  • threshold (int, optional) – Threshold for early stopping. Default is 20.

Returns:

Trained LSTM model, RMSE (Root Mean Squared Error), MAE (Mean Absolute Error), MBE (Mean Bias Error), KGE (Kling-Gupta Efficiency), and R^2 score.

Return type:

tuple(torch.nn.Module, float, float, float, float, float)

models.train_model(model, ts, n_features, train_loader, val_loader, optimiser, criterion, scheduler, is_early_stop=False, threshold=20)¶

Train and validate the LSTM model.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to be trained and validated, such as LSTM.

  • ts (int) – The time sequence length, the number of time steps to be considered in model.

  • n_features (int) – The number of features used in training.

  • train_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – The training data loader used to train the model.

  • val_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – The validation data loader used to validate the model.

  • optimiser (torch.optim.Adam) – The optimiser to update the weights of model during the training, such as Adam.

  • criterion (torch.nn.modules) – The loss function used to calcualte the training and validation loss, such as MSE.

  • scheduler (torch.optim.lr_scheduler.StepLR.) – The scheduler used to adjust learning rate

  • is_early_stop (bool, optional) – Whether to enable early stopping or not, default is False.

  • threshold (int, optional) – Determine when to stop the training, e.g stop if no improvement in the next ‘threshold’ continuous epochs, default is 20 epochs.

Returns:

A tuple containing the training and validation losses for each epoch.

Return type:

tuple(list, list)
